name: spanntastic
text: Stimmy Cell

name: trapperjohn
text: A comment left by trapperjohn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sirhan_duran, NeoNaoNeo, redion, Jesler729, Deusoma, Ariamaki)

name: whuppins
text: I like this strip, but you would think that Lazarus has done enough schmoozing to know how uncool it is to talk during someone's backswing. Poor golf course etiquette can be a deal-breaker.

name: whuppins
text:
Shit, I just realized... a tasseled loafer wouldn't have any idea what goes on during a round of golf. It'd be stuck in the trunk of the car.

Damn you, Onstad

Always one step ahead

Damn you, Onstad

Always one step ahead

name: whuppins
text: I wish you could edit your comments. No idea why that last bit was double-posted.

name: gompo
text: It was pretty funny though.

name: thatskotkid
text: Accidental Poetry continues its struggle as a burgeoning  Internet art form.

name: ferdinand
text:
there are three types of typographical errors, and they are as follows:

errors perpetrated maliciously by a disgruntled typesetter

errors introduced accidentally, without purpose or intended function

errors introduced divinely, wherein the typesetter is influenced unknowingly by the hand of god.

these types are INDISTINGUISHABLE and therefore in effect, the same thing. proofreading, then, becomes unnecessary and indeed reprehensible.


this is a paraphrase of a beautiful poem by a man whose name i cannot remember.

name: unfun
text: The Printer's Error

name: jackhuman
text: Disguised like normal errors, these errors can at once transform the life of their typist!

name: stormagnet
text: Your feelings on the matter wree clearly so emphatic they echoed.

text: personally i think it worked in your favour. like the first time it didn't take, so you said it again, perhaps  slamming your fist down onto a table this time.

name: sargasm
text: If only Lazarus knew that Ray's political candidate is actually a five-year-old who wants to give homeless people free stays at Motel 6.

name: abe
text: Its Comminuss' I tells ya!!!

name: presterjohn
text: As long as he had lead time to buy stock in Motel 6 Lazarus would endorse this plan.

name: professorhazard
text: The alt text is incorrect. I do not know Lazarus's politics.

name: songbirdspectre
text: it is the Devil Shoe.

name: snowman
text: In panels 5 and 6, the hole moves over to Ray .

name: vondicus
text: Such is the power of the casual shoe, yes.

name: desert_donkey
text: if you look a philippe really quick in the last frame, he kinda reminds you (me) of former President Dwight D. "Ike" Eisenhower (dec).

name: fuzzyshoo
text:
Even with one shoe on, the players game does not suffer.

Shine on, Ray Smuckles. Shine on.

name: fuzzyshoo
text:
i have a new love for this strip. i just noticed that ray took a divot after hitting the ball. his finish stance is clean and correct. he also putts the ball off of his front foot.

look, i like golf. a lot. i'm sorry.
